intro: Urandra monticola, commonly known as the mountain urandra, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is adapted to the cool, moist conditions of mountainous areas. Urandra monticola is often found in cloud forests and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
